title: 5.1 patch is the the cause of my frustration.
body:
{{champion:51}} 
So I hope a lot of people are seeing this, I have poured over many a thread searching for the solution so that my League of Legends client will continue to work, but alas here I am creating my own discussion. I've tried most things that are available on the internet in terms of my problem. Here's the situation, I open the client and everything seems to be in working order, however, once the update reaches 32% my speed plummets to 0KBpS and a warning comes up saying "Unspecified error occured. Please check the Logs for more information... Continue... Send Logs" If I click either option bugsplat occurs. Please I am getting desperate, I've tried uninstalling/reinstalling the game, deleting everything in D:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects etc.. and many other possible solutions that ended up being more problematic than anything. Attached is the error message, help on this subject would be much appreciated.

replies.body:
>Attached is the error message

Nothing is attached.

Also, I'm getting this same error, and have tried basically everything as well. What OS are you on, and how are you connected to the internet?

That's strange I put two images onto it, anyway I am on windows 7 and I'm connected through wifi. I've also tried putting the program in compatibility mode and running as administrator etc... But nothing has worked, if you figure it out please let me know. Kind regards IGN- MorgothStormcrow if you want to add me (I realise that it shows it already in this thread). {{champion:51}}

>if you want to add me

When I get the bloody game launching right, I'll try. ;)

Right now I'm trying disabling peer to peer transfers and then repairing it after that (again).

Hi guys,

Sucks to hear you are having patching issues like this :(

It sounds like you have tried a whole bunch of possible solutions already, but if you haven't already, I'd suggest you take a look at the [patching issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues) page on our support site.  Just double-check you have tried everything listed there.

If you are still having problems after that, I'd send a support request in (click on "support" at the top right of the boards site) and someone should be able to help.

-Mindstar

I fixed this problem for my Oceania server by updating my ethernet drivers and using this: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/299357

But this solution still does not solve my NA account problem.

My OCEANIA WORKS BUT NA STILL DONT:(
